name: overtls
description: Simple proxy tunnel for bypassing the GFW

repo.name: overtls
repo.description: A minimalist proxy tunnel for bypassing the GFW.

readme.summary: Comprehensive documentation with good installation coverage but lacks concrete usage examples and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Missing concrete end-to-end examples showing actual client-server setup and common troubleshooting scenarios

injection_risks.description: The use of `std::ffi::CString` and `unsafe { overtls::over_tls_client_run(config_path, opt.verbosity, Some(port_cb), std::ptr::null_mut()) };` could lead to a buffer overflow if the input is not properly validated.

The use of `std::ffi::CString` and `unsafe { overtls::over_tls_client_run_with_ssr_url(url_ptr, listen_addr, opt.verbosity, Some(port_cb), std::ptr::null_mut()) };` could lead to a buffer overflow if the input is not properly validated.

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the use of `std::ffi::CString` and `unsafe { overtls::over_tls_client_run(config_path, opt.verbosity, Some(port_cb), std::ptr::null_mut()) };`
Lack of thorough input validation for `opt.config` and `opt.url_of_node`
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential buffer overflow vulnerabilities and lack of thorough input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows best practices.

common_complaints: Performance/latency issues (20% slower than competing protocols)
Limited platform support (MIPS24KC musl variant requested)
sentiment.summary: Community shows modest engagement but slow maintainer responsiveness to technical issues, with users reporting performance concerns and requesting platform/integration support that remains unresolved.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing a good level of technical depth and patience. However, there is room for improvement in the clarity of some explanations.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-31)
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of issue triage
3 open issues with no resolution activity
Unknown/missing last release date suggests release process has stalled
positive_signals: Recent commit exists (2025-12-31) showing some minimal recent activity
maintenance.summary: The project appears abandoned with zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite having open issues and recent code history.
